column4: i didn't get any output from   sudo aptitude install ssh-server   is that good or bad?
sudo apt-get install openssh-server   doesn't give any output, neither does aptitude. what is going wrong?
take a look at the file /etc/apt/sources.list
there'll be a line that looks like this: # deb http://za.archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu hoary main restricted
the leading '#' is a comment character. remove it and save the file.
try sudo -s -H ? you should get a root prompt
you said you installed a 'server' install ?
i'm not familiar with that setup. did you choose an 'expert' mode or anything similar ?
